properties.name: Advice
properties.location: areas of the Grampians National Park affected by fire.
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for areas of the Grampians National Park affected by fire.
  • The status of the bushfire in the Grampians National Park is now Under Control.
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice message issued at 3.03pm Thursday 16 January.
  • Firefighters and heavy machinery continue to monitor hotspots, treat hazardous trees, clear tracks and rehabilitate control lines.
  • Small areas of smoke within the containment area may be visible.
 
Many popular sites in the Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park are open, however areas affected by fire are closed as they remain extremely dangerous. Fines may apply if you are found behind road and walking track closures.  

For details on access to the park, visit the Parks Vic website or Brambuk - The National Park and Cultural Centre in Halls Gap.

Halls Gap and surrounding towns are open. Businesses and the community are welcoming visitors back to the area. 

Plan your trip before you leave - visit VicTraffic.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Drive with caution. Obey road closure signs.  
  • Visitors are reminded to be cautious of ongoing risks and changes to the environment which may include fallen or damaged trees, smoke and injured wildlife.
  • If you see impacted wildlife - call 1300 356 682. 
Recovery and resilience
If you have been or may be impacted by bushfire, it is understandable if you are feeling concerned and experiencing a mix of strong mental, emotional or physical reactions right now. For emergency relief information during major incidents, call the VicEmergency hotline on 1800 226 226 or visit www.emergency.vic.gov.au/relief
Impacts in your area: 
  • Drivers may encounter fire crews and heavy machinery on roads and tracks. Please take care and drive safely. 
  • Many roads within the fire affected area remain closed. Check the VicTaffic website or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 28/01/2025 03:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: ADVICE - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed Incident Location: Grampians National Park Issue Date: Tuesday 21 January 2025, 03:08 pm Next Update: Tuesday 28 January 2025, 03:00 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35860/moreinfo This Advice message is being issued for areas of the Grampians National Park affected by fire. - The status of the bushfire in the Grampians National Park is now Under Control. - This Advice message replaces the Advice message issued at 3.03pm Thursday 16 January. - Firefighters and heavy machinery continue to monitor hotspots, treat hazardous trees, clear tracks and rehabilitate control lines. - Small areas of smoke within the containment area may be visible. Many popular sites in the Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park are open, however areas affected by fire are closed as they remain extremely dangerous. Fines may apply if you are found behind road and walking track closures. For details on access to the park, visit the Parks Vic website or Brambuk - The National Park and Cultural Centre in Halls Gap. Halls Gap and surrounding towns are open. Businesses and the community are welcoming visitors back to the area. Plan your trip before you leave - visit VicTraffic. There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Boroka Track, west of Halls Gap
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Boroka Track, west of Halls Gap. 
  • The bushfire at Boroka Track, Grampians National Park is under control.
  • Due to works to repair access to the area, Boroka Track and Lookout will remain close.

Many popular sites in the Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park are open, however areas affected by fire are closed as they remain extremely dangerous. Fines may apply if you are found behind road and walking track closures.  

For details on access to the park, visit the ParksVic website or Brambuk - The National Park and Cultural Centre in Halls Gap. Halls Gap and surrounding towns are open. 

Plan your trip before you leave - visit VicTraffic.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

This will be the final message for this fire.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text: COMMUNITY INFORMATION - BUSHFIRE - Stay Informed Incident Location: Boroka Track, Grampians National Park Issue Date: Saturday 25 January 2025, 02:23 pm Next Update: Tuesday 28 January 2025, 12:00 pm More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35889/moreinfo This Community Information message is being issued for Boroka Track, west of Halls Gap. - The bushfire at Boroka Track, Grampians National Park is under control. - Due to works to repair access to the area, Boroka Track and Lookout will remain close. Many popular sites in the Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park are open, however areas affected by fire are closed as they remain extremely dangerous. Fines may apply if you are found behind road and walking track closures. For details on access to the park, visit the ParksVic website or Brambuk - The National Park and Cultural Centre in Halls Gap. Halls Gap and surrounding towns are open. Plan your trip before you leave - visit VicTraffic. There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Altona, Altona Meadows, Altona North, Laverton North
properties.webBody:
The Threat is Reduced following the grassfire at Purnell Street, Altona. 
  • The grassfire in the Laverton Wetlands is now under control. 
  • Smoke is travelling northerly over the Princes Freeway towards Dohertys Road, slow down and drive to conditions. 
  • This Advice message replaces the Watch and Act issued at 4:49PM 26 January 2025.
People located within Altona, Altona Meadows, Altona North, Laverton North are now able to resume normal activities.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Emergency services will remain in the area. 
  • Smoke will be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Fire Rescue Victoria.  

This will be the final message issued for this fire. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
ADVICE - GRASS FIRE - Threat Is Reduced
Incident Location: Purnell Street, Altona
Issue Date: Sunday 26 January 2025, 06:48 pm
Next Update: Sunday 26 January 2025, 09:30 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35899/moreinfo

The Threat is Reduced following the grassfire at Purnell Street, Altona. 
- The grassfire in the Laverton Wetlands is now under control. 
- Smoke is travelling northerly over the Princes Freeway towards Dohertys Road, slow down and drive to conditions.  
- This Advice message replaces the Watch and Act issued at 4:49PM 26 January 2025. 


People located within Altona, Altona Meadows, Altona North, Laverton North are now able to resume normal activities.
